devdoc.author: Yining Hu
devdoc.details: contract currently assume one buyer account and one seller account, should develop an additional wallet contract and allow new user registrationTo do: to implement multi-sig, time-based escrowTo do: to add a product existence modifier, and a role modifierTo do: the easiest would be to transfer both money and ownership of the product to the agent then to prevent agent from taking everything, agent needs to deposit, which can be slashed if caught faulty

BuyerDeposit(string).details: Partial payment is sent to the seller, however, can change depending on the agreement

constructor.details: before setting up any user wallet, all buyers/sellers use a single buyer/seller address, which are maintained by Beston.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

agentaddr.details: Roles are referred to by their bytes32 identifier. These should be exposed in the external API and be unique.

devdoc.title: EscrowService Contract, forked from https://github.com/AleRapchan/escrow-service

AgentApprove(string).notice: Seller can redeem with verification Achieves the same payment result as BuyerApprove, but requires seller to pay for execution

AgentDeny(string).notice: Buyer can deny the payment upon unsatisfactory verification result or for other reasons.

BuyerDeposit(string).notice: Buyer can make a deposit to products on offer

userdoc.notice: Building a single role access control Escrow Service using OpenZeppelin Escrow and RBAC
